did.abstract: Correspondece and other materials relating to Churchill's time as a trustee of Vassar College, particularly regarding international alumni.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Ruth Hornblower Churchill (VC 1908), VC alumna trustee, compiled The Home Bible and wrote Mother's Chronicle. A kindergarten and first grade teacher, Churchill co-founded the Harvard Arlington Guidance Program. Churchill was married to three husbands: Robert Atkins, Chester Greenough and Lawrence W. Churchill.

chronitem.event: Chester Noyes, Harvard University English Professor, Greenough died

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Ruth Churchill Papers include correspondence, drafts of speeches eulogizing VC alumni Harriet Sawyer and Martha Bowie Branch, and materials related to Alumnae House events. Particularly notable is the correspondence between Churchill and VC international alumni regarding VC's impact on their lives as well as their activities since graduation.
